title: Power by Association
excerpt: We examine how power might influence the cultural evolution of inequitable norms between discernible groups (such as gender or racial groups) in a population of otherwise identical individuals.
citation: Travis LaCroix and Cailin O'Connor. (2018). "Power by Association." Unpublished 1.

title: Salience and Signalling in Sender Receiver Games: Partial Pooling, Learning, and Focal Points
venue: Synthese  In Lewis' (1969) conception of a signalling game, salience is offered as an explanation for how individuals may come to agree upon a linguistic convention. Skyrms (2018) offers a dynamic explanation of how signalling conventions might arise presupposing no salience whatsoever. I extend the atomic signalling game to include a variable parameter which allows for 'degrees' of salience, thus filling in the continuum between Skyrms' and Lewis' respective models.
excerpt: Travis LaCroix. (2018). "On Salience and Signaling in Sender-Receiver Games: Partial Pooling, Learning, and Focal Points." Synthese 1. Forthcoming.
